revision.comment: /* Related to bombing of Chinese Embassy in Belgrade? */
revision.text: {{WPMILHIST |class = B | B1 = y | B2 = y | B3 = y | B4 = y | B5 = y | Aviation = yes | Balkan = yes | US = yes}} {{dyktalk|30 September|2012|entry=... that the '''[[1999 F-117A shoot-down|shooting down of an F-117]]''' in 1999 during the [[NATO bombing of Yugoslavia]] was the first confirmed downing of a [[stealth aircraft]]?}} == De-Construct.Net == This website is repeatedly cited in the article, but I don't see why it should be considered a reliable source. It appears to be some kind of extremist (pro-Serbian?) political website - it has an image depicting Barrack Obama as satan on its front page along with an article calling Vladamir Putin "a true statesman and the greatest leader the world has seen since World War II" for instance, and provides no information I can see on the credentials of the people who write for it. [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 00:11, 26 October 2012 (UTC) :I concur, this is an unacceptable source, and needs to be replaced before the article can be considered B-class or better. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 14:45, 27 October 2012 (UTC) ::I've done a slash-and-burn first-version removal. [[User:Buckshot06|Buckshot06]] [[User_talk:Buckshot06|(talk)]] 06:55, 28 October 2012 (UTC) :::de-construct.net is still being used as a reference to one sentence. ([[User:Hohum|'''Hohum''']] [[User talk:Hohum|@]]) 14:10, 28 October 2012 (UTC) Nothing cited to this website seemed controversial, but if it is indeed some kind of extremist website, I guess we should not be using it. Please list removed claims here, so that others can try to find more reliable refs for them. --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User talk:Piotrus| reply here]] 17:19, 29 October 2012 (UTC) :Bukshot's diff is [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=1999_F-117A_shoot-down&diff=520212269&oldid=520120069 here]. [[User:Buggie111|Buggie111]] ([[User talk:Buggie111|talk]]) 04:50, 11 November 2012 (UTC) == 1999? Or 1998? == I've read various secondary sources that state this aircraft was shot down in March 1999, but I remember it in the news and where I was when I saw the footage, and I was only there in early 1998. Am I having a "senior moment"? [[User:Evets70|Evets70]] ([[User talk:Evets70|talk]]) 16:17, 26 February 2015 (UTC) :Yep, you're having a "senior moment" there. :) Aside from all the sources, I also remember seeing this in the news when it happened and I know exactly where I was in March 1999 - Serbia (Yugoslavia). NATO aircraft were really fond of that place at the time (which wasn't the case for any other timeframe except March - June 1999). :) [[User:BytEfLUSh|BytEfLUSh]] | [[User talk:BytEfLUSh|Talk!]] 23:25, 28 February 2015 (UTC) == [[WP:GAN]] == I think the article can be considered for a [[WP:GAN]]. Any editors interested in co-nominating this? --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User talk:Piotrus| reply here]] 01:51, 28 April 2015 (UTC) :I don't think it should be nominated for anything until all of the "references" are properly formatted and displayed without any "Cite errors". [[Special:Contributions/100.37.25.224|100.37.25.224]] ([[User talk:100.37.25.224|talk]]) 23:24, 11 October 2015 (UTC) ::Thanks for [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=1999_F-117A_shootdown&type=revision&diff=685333429&oldid=684799247 fixing this]. --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User talk:Piotrus| reply here]] 08:44, 12 October 2015 (UTC) == Related to bombing of Chinese Embassy in Belgrade? == At the time I heard a rumor that some of the wreckage had been purchased by agents of the Chinese government and brought to their embassy (which one of the Serbian civilians who lived in the area and found some of the wreckage has verified), five weeks later the U.S. "accidentally" sent guided bombs straight into the building (and fifteen years later China released their own stealth bomber, the Chengdu J-20)...something should be added to the article [[User:Historian932|Historian932]] ([[User talk:Historian932|talk]]) 14:29, 15 October 2015 (UTC)
